verbs.description: [ARG0: six - year - old cancer survivor] [V: gets] [ARG1: chance to thank bone marrow donor who saved her life six - year - old rebecca skrycki known as bekah has been cancer - free for over a year thanks to a bone marrow transplant from a stranger if that not enough to smile about the little wayland girl recently met the donor face to face i just wanted to hug him and say thank you bekah said he is awesome he saved my life on sept 17 at a baseball game in cleveland between the indians and the detroit tigers bekah and her parents joe and amy skrycki met the donor anthony colangelo 27 he was a registered bone marrow donor through bethematch org anthony is the skrycki family hero joe said his birthday is coming up and we got him a mug that says i am a bone marrow donor what is your superpower bekah was first diagnosed with myelomonocytic leukemia a cancer of the bone marrow on nov 3 2015 when she was 3 when she relapsed in november 2016 after months in remission a transplant was her only chance for a cure amy said they had to] wait a year before they could request contact information for the man who was a perfect bone marrow match for bekah after that time amy rebecca skrycki cancer bone marrow bekah skrycki detroit tigers amy skrycki leukemia wayland facebook joe anthony colangelo cleveland baseball bone

[ARG0: six - year - old cancer survivor] gets chance to [V: thank] [ARG1: bone marrow donor who saved her life six - year - old rebecca skrycki known as bekah] has been cancer - free for over a year thanks to a bone marrow transplant from a stranger if that not enough to smile about the little wayland girl recently met the donor face to face i just wanted to hug him and say thank you bekah said he is awesome he saved my life on sept 17 at a baseball game in cleveland between the indians and the detroit tigers bekah and her parents joe and amy skrycki met the donor anthony colangelo 27 he was a registered bone marrow donor through bethematch org anthony is the skrycki family hero joe said his birthday is coming up and we got him a mug that says i am a bone marrow donor what is your superpower bekah was first diagnosed with myelomonocytic leukemia a cancer of the bone marrow on nov 3 2015 when she was 3 when she relapsed in november 2016 after months in remission a transplant was her only chance for a cure amy said they had to wait a year before they could request contact information for the man who was a perfect bone marrow match for bekah after that time amy rebecca skrycki cancer bone marrow bekah skrycki detroit tigers amy skrycki leukemia wayland facebook joe anthony colangelo cleveland baseball bone

six - year - old cancer survivor gets chance to thank [ARG0: bone marrow donor] [R-ARG0: who] [V: saved] [ARG1: her life] [ARGM-TMP: six - year - old rebecca skrycki] known as bekah has been cancer - free for over a year thanks to a bone marrow transplant from a stranger if that not enough to smile about the little wayland girl recently met the donor face to face i just wanted to hug him and say thank you bekah said he is awesome he saved my life on sept 17 at a baseball game in cleveland between the indians and the detroit tigers bekah and her parents joe and amy skrycki met the donor anthony colangelo 27 he was a registered bone marrow donor through bethematch org anthony is the skrycki family hero joe said his birthday is coming up and we got him a mug that says i am a bone marrow donor what is your superpower bekah was first diagnosed with myelomonocytic leukemia a cancer of the bone marrow on nov 3 2015 when she was 3 when she relapsed in november 2016 after months in remission a transplant was her only chance for a cure amy said they had to wait a year before they could request contact information for the man who was a perfect bone marrow match for bekah after that time amy rebecca skrycki cancer bone marrow bekah skrycki detroit tigers amy skrycki leukemia wayland facebook joe anthony colangelo cleveland baseball bone

six - year - old cancer survivor gets chance to thank bone marrow donor who saved her life [ARG1: six - year - old rebecca skrycki] [V: known] [ARG2: as bekah] has been cancer - free for over a year thanks to a bone marrow transplant from a stranger if that not enough to smile about the little wayland girl recently met the donor face to face i just wanted to hug him and say thank you bekah said he is awesome he saved my life on sept 17 at a baseball game in cleveland between the indians and the detroit tigers bekah and her parents joe and amy skrycki met the donor anthony colangelo 27 he was a registered bone marrow donor through bethematch org anthony is the skrycki family hero joe said his birthday is coming up and we got him a mug that says i am a bone marrow donor what is your superpower bekah was first diagnosed with myelomonocytic leukemia a cancer of the bone marrow on nov 3 2015 when she was 3 when she relapsed in november 2016 after months in remission a transplant was her only chance for a cure amy said they had to wait a year before they could request contact information for the man who was a perfect bone marrow match for bekah after that time amy rebecca skrycki cancer bone marrow bekah skrycki detroit tigers amy skrycki leukemia wayland facebook joe anthony colangelo cleveland baseball bone
